name: Aravind Datla
title: MS Access Developer & Data Integration Specialist
professional_summary: Developed comprehensive MS Access solutions for healthcare data management, implementing VBA modules and ActiveX Data Objects to ensure HIPAA compliance while maintaining seamless data flow between legacy systems and modern platforms.

Engineered database splitting techniques for healthcare applications, separating front-end and back-end components to enhance performance and security, enabling multiple users to access patient information simultaneously without data corruption.

Translated complex business logic from MS Access macros and queries to optimized SQL Server stored procedures, significantly improving data processing speed for healthcare analytics while preserving all original functionality.
Migrated critical healthcare data from MS Access to SQL Server, implementing proper data validation and transformation processes to ensure patient information integrity during the transition period.

Converted legacy MS Access forms and reports to web-based applications using modern frameworks, providing healthcare professionals with remote access to patient data while maintaining strict security protocols.
Utilized Visual Basic for Applications to create custom automation tools for healthcare billing systems, reducing manual data entry errors and streamlining the insurance claims processing workflow.
Designed and implemented ETL processes for healthcare data integration, using MS Access as the staging environment before moving data to enterprise data warehouses for comprehensive analysis.
Developed secure data access controls in MS Access applications, implementing role-based permissions to ensure only authorized healthcare personnel could view or modify sensitive patient information.
Created complex MS Access queries with optimized joins and filters to extract meaningful insights from large healthcare datasets, supporting clinical decision-making and research initiatives.
Implemented ActiveX Data Objects connectivity between MS Access and various healthcare systems, enabling real-time data synchronization and eliminating manual data transfer processes.
Built custom reporting solutions in MS Access for healthcare compliance monitoring, automating the generation of regulatory reports required by HIPAA and other healthcare governing bodies.
Architected a hybrid solution combining MS Access front-end with SQL Server back-end for a major healthcare provider, balancing user familiarity with enterprise-level data management capabilities.
Developed data validation routines using VBA to ensure data quality in healthcare applications, implementing checks for completeness, accuracy, and consistency before allowing data entry.
Designed user-friendly MS Access interfaces for healthcare professionals with limited technical expertise, creating intuitive forms and navigation systems that required minimal training.
Implemented version control practices for MS Access applications, creating a systematic approach to database updates that ensured all changes were properly documented and tested before deployment.
Created automated data archiving solutions for MS Access healthcare databases, implementing rules-based systems to move historical patient data to appropriate storage while maintaining accessibility.
Optimized MS Access database performance through proper indexing, query refinement, and relationship management, ensuring responsive application performance even with large datasets.
Established comprehensive documentation standards for MS Access healthcare applications, creating detailed technical guides that facilitated knowledge transfer and future maintenance.

responsibilities: Engineered a comprehensive MS Access solution for pharmacy inventory management, implementing VBA modules with ActiveX Data Objects to connect with multiple healthcare systems while ensuring HIPAA compliance throughout the data flow.

Developed a sophisticated database splitting strategy for the patient management system, separating front-end and back-end components to improve performance and security, allowing approximately 200 pharmacists to access data simultaneously.

Translated complex business logic from legacy MS Access macros to optimized SQL Server stored procedures, reducing data processing time for prescription fulfillment by implementing proper indexing and query optimization techniques.

Migrated critical patient data from multiple MS Access databases to a centralized SQL Server environment, creating custom VBA validation routines to ensure data integrity during the transition period.

Converted legacy MS Access forms and reports to a web-based application using .NET framework, providing healthcare professionals with secure remote access to patient information while maintaining all original functionality.

Utilized Visual Basic for Applications to create custom automation tools for insurance claim processing, implementing complex business rules that reduced manual intervention by around 70% in the claims workflow.

Designed and implemented ETL processes using MS Access as the staging environment, creating data transformation routines that prepared healthcare data for integration with enterprise analytics platforms.

Developed role-based security controls in MS Access applications, implementing user authentication systems that ensured only authorized healthcare personnel could access sensitive patient information.

Created complex MS Access queries with optimized joins and subqueries to extract meaningful insights from prescription data, supporting clinical research initiatives and identifying potential drug interactions.
Implemented ActiveX Data Objects connectivity between MS Access and various pharmacy management systems, enabling real-time data synchronization and eliminating manual data transfer processes.
Built custom reporting solutions in MS Access for healthcare compliance monitoring, automating the generation of regulatory reports required by HIPAA and other healthcare governing bodies.
Architected a hybrid solution combining MS Access front-end with SQL Server back-end for the pharmacy chain, balancing user familiarity with enterprise-level data management capabilities.

Developed data validation routines using VBA to ensure data quality in pharmacy applications, implementing checks for prescription accuracy, dosage limits, and patient allergies before allowing data entry.
Designed user-friendly MS Access interfaces for pharmacy staff with varying technical expertise, creating intuitive forms and navigation systems that required minimal training and reduced errors.

Implemented version control practices for MS Access healthcare applications, creating a systematic approach to database updates that ensured all changes were properly documented and tested before deployment.

Created automated data archiving solutions for MS Access pharmacy databases, implementing rules-based systems to move historical prescription data to appropriate storage while maintaining accessibility.
Optimized MS Access database performance through proper indexing, query refinement, and relationship management, ensuring responsive application performance even with large patient datasets.

Established comprehensive documentation standards for MS Access healthcare applications, creating detailed technical guides that facilitated knowledge transfer and future maintenance by the development team.
